basics.name: Rovie Jay Dacumos
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in 2020.

courses: Intoduction to Computer Science I & II (ICS 111, 211) Discrete Mathematics I && II (ICS 141, 241)

education.area: Philippine Language and Literature: Filipino (expected Spring, 2020)
courses: Four years of language study (FIL 101 - 402), Translation Techniques (FIL 435), Other literature courses in the Indo-Pacific department

work.company: UH Manoa Center for Philippine Studies
work.summary: I do office work for the director of the Center for Philippine Studies, work on projects for the Center for Southeast Asian Studies, and the Filipino language and literature program.
highlights: Turrns Philippine folklore into digital storybooks through animations

volunteer.summary: As an Officer (1 year): Manage online activity for the RIO of the Filipino Club
highlights: Maintains the club website by posting announcements, resources, and photos
Plan Filipino related events for the club such as Drama-Fest, Song-Fest, or piknik where they can showcase their skills in the language
Attends cultural/language performances by the lower level courses

volunteer.summary: Set up two computer labs in a public housing complex.
highlights: Take inventory of computers and parts
Helped put computers out by configuring environment, adding needed software, etc.
Occasionally helped solve simple computer issues.

awards.title: B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.

awards.title: Scholarship Recipient
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to resident in their complex.

summary.title: Academic Honors
summary.summary: I graduated with summa cum laude while fulfilling requirements of the honors.
